lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: I want people to have opportunities to support themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: I want to help developing economies and bring stability to them.  I want to see the United States return to greatness and I believe that takes more than sporadically supporting democracy in other countries.   I believe that there is no such thing as freedom without economic freedom and there is no such thing as political power without economic power.  I love  the creativity, guts, drive and independence of the entrepreneurial spirit !
lenders.occupational_info: I serve food in a Japanese restaurant.  I run back and forth from the kitchen all night running dishes out to the tables and presenting them to guests.

lenders.name: Michaela
lenders.loan_because:
There was a man who was walking along a sandy beach where thousands of starfish had been washed up on the shore. He noticed a boy picking the 
starfish one by one and throwing them back into the ocean. The man observed 
the boy for a few minutes and then asked what he was doing. The boy replied that he was returning the starfish to the sea, otherwise they would die.
The man asked how saving a few, when so many were doomed, would make any 
difference whatsoever? The boy picked up a starfish and threw it back into 
the ocean and said "It made a difference to that one..."

lenders.name: Cooper

lenders.occupational_info: My work is extremely challenging.  Aside from my philanthropic pursuits, I spend my days playing, eating, sleeping and reading (or, more accurately, being read to).  I am currently attempting to master running, jumping and speaking (albeit not at the same time).

lenders.name: Gisela
lenders.loan_because:
I know from experience how important it is to get help when you start your own business.
My respect for all who try this under difficult conditions!

lenders.name: Charlotte
lenders.loan_because: Its cool to help other people!  My dad gave me a Kiva account for my birthday to help me learn about micro lending, and how even a young person can make a big difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I am helping to repair the world.

lenders.name: Kristina
lenders.occupational_info: Selling international air tickets

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: Kiva provides a simple, easy and very practical way to help others around the world. It can also be a way of saving money for retirement while causing the creation of real value where it is really needed far in excess of the bit of interest foregone.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a public servant, but my vocation is that of helper.

lenders.name: Winder & Trina
lenders.loan_because:
I am lending because I always wanted to help people when I had “the money”, but God is teaching me a great lesson. A big event has occurred in my life which is the opposite of having “the money”. I have lost a lot money in this economy and I am practically starting all over again, but this time with a better foundation “help people first and make money second”.
God has touched my wife and my sister in law Karlla in a way that I could have never imagined. Everything start the day that this picture was taken in the estate of  Anzoategui, a small town call El Tigrito Venezuela. We took our fist born son, Kianno, to the 7 Day Adventist Church to be dedicated at six months of age in the church where I was baptize as a child.
Since that day my wife has been baptized in the 7 Day Adventist Church and now she is to follow God.
I am doing my best to keep up with my wife and my sister in law in their faith in God.
God bless all the people that are lending and all the people that are receiving the blessing from the lenders.
Thanks to Kiva for making this possible.
Winder Montaño.

lenders.name: Noma & Ash
lenders.loan_because:
We believe in empowering others to achieve self-sufficiency. 

Instead of giving wedding anniversary gifts to each other annually, we donate to Kiva the sum we would have spent.

691 loans to date ... and counting!

Friends viewing this page who are unfamiliar with Kiva: Please note that the beauty of micro-finance donations is in that your "seed donation money" can be used to help more than the original recipient.  Once the short-term loan is paid back into your Kiva account, you can re-loan the money to someone else in need.  Unlike other "conventional" forms of charitable donation, this is truly a gift that keeps on giving!

lenders.loan_because: I feel it is my duty to help those who are not as fortunate as I am.  I donate in the name of puppymill dogs.  I also donate in the memory of my beloved mother, a humble and extraordinary woman who gave more of herself to others during the hard days of WWII than anyone can be expected to.  She also taught me the importance of loving and giving, and the pleasure that comes therein.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: It was just luck, karma, what have you, that we were born in a country with more than enough to go around.

lenders.name: Rajiv Vutukuru
lenders.loan_because: I like giving and helping others in need wherever the need may be in the world.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am an incoming freshman (Fall 2012)  at Michigan State University, East Lansing, MI.

 The following quote motivated me to help through KIVA.
"While wandering a deserted beach at dawn, stagnant in my work, I saw a man in the distance bending and throwing as he walked the endless stretch toward me. As he came near, I could see that he was throwing starfish, abandoned on the sand by the tide, back into the sea. When he was close enough I asked him why he was working so hard at this strange task. He said that the sun would dry the starfish and they would die. I said to him that I thought he was foolish. there were thousands of starfish on miles and miles of beach. One man alone could never make a difference. He smiled as he picked up the next starfish. Hurling it far into the sea he said, "It makes a difference for this one." I abandoned my writing and spent the morning throwing starfish." ― Loren Eiseley
